data.event: Wilmington was first settled in 1665 and was officially incorporated in 1730, from parts of Woburn, Reading, and Billerica.
Wilmington was first settled in 1665 and was officially incorporated in 1730, from parts of Woburn, Reading, and Billerica.

event.title: fled to the opposite side of a large swamp, in what is now

data.event: Once he attained his freedom, he fled to the opposite side of a large swamp, in what is now Wilmington.

event.title: settled in Reading, in an area that is now

data.event: Harnden settled in Reading, in an area that is now part of Wilmington.
Jaquith settled in an area of Billerica that became part of Wilmington in 1737.

event.title: responded to the alarm on April 19, 1775

data.event: Minutemen from Wilmington responded to the alarm on April 19, 1775 and fought at Merriam's Corner in Concord.
Chartered in 1792, opened in 1803, it provided freight and passenger transport between the Merrimack River and Boston.
Chartered in 1792, opened in 1803, it provided freight and passenger transport between the Merrimack River and Boston.
